channel.title: The Coast to Coast Real Estate Investor
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description:
The Coast to Coast Investor is a Talkcast for people are interested in investing in real estate across the country. It is for those who want to learn how to locate, buy, finance, and manage real estate investments outside of their immediate market area.
The Talkcast will examine how to locate property, research real estate markets and investments, work with remote professionals like agents, appraisers, and property managers, negotiate and write offers remotely, and manage property effectively from afar. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

image.title: The Coast to Coast Real Estate Investor

channel.itunes:author: William Flood
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Coast to Coast Real Estate Investor

channel.itunes:keywords: real estate, real estate investing, real estate investor, property, investing, wealth, entrepreneurship, money, coast, real, investor, estate, "real estate investing"

item.title: EPISODE40 - How to Get Financed in This Mortgage Market
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this live broadcast I will be discussing the personal, public challenge I made to finance a recent deal. Learn the outcome of dealing with 25 mortgage companies, 5 government programs and 2 private lenders to finance an investment property. Learn what works and what doesn't and what you should be doing right now to buy property.
item.itunes:author: William Flood
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE40 - How to Get Financed in This Mortgage Market
item.itunes:summary: In this live broadcast I will be discussing the personal, public challenge I made to finance a recent deal. item.title: EPISODE39 - Three Great Websites for Out of State Real Estate Investing
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
So many people appreciate Internet tools for real estate investing that I thought I would dedicate a Podcast to three of my favorite investor oriented websites.
These are Internet sites that I use literally daily as a real estate investor. Not only will I be providing you with information on the sites themselves, I'll be telling you how to use them effectively for your out-of-area investing.
item.itunes:author: William Flood

item.title: EPISODE38 - Another Entrepreneurial Opportunity - the Import/Export Busines
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This podcast episode is for people who want to look at additional entrepreneurial opportunities along with real estate. If you want multiple streams of income, here's a business you'll want to consider.
I'm going to introduce the import/export business as a prelude to my upcoming online class starting April 22.
Learn about world trade as a business opportunity where you can potentially make thousands of dollars, work from home, have tax deductible travel, interact with other cultures, and do it all with little or no risk.
The class begins Wednesday April 22 and runs 12 week. It's fully online so you can work on it anywher and any time you can access the Internet! The course tuition is $179. Contact me at 614-886-8233 or whflood@yahoo.com to register or get additional information.

item.title: EPISODE37 - Real Estate Investing for 2009 (Unplugged!)
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
If you are sitting on the sidelines as a real estate investor because you've been hearing all the doom and gloom, I want to inspire you to get back in the game...NOW! This month! This WEEK! This market is not an opportunity to be missed. If you want to build wealth through owning property, now is the time! If you want to make quick profits flipping properties...now it the time!
In this latest podcast I am going to be giving you my best brain dump on what you should be doing, and where you should be looking as a real estate investor. And, I'm going to be doing it fully unscripted so I won't be constrained by a format. Join the show; ask questions; pick my brain, and let me give you information on everything and anything you should be doing as an investor in 2009.

item.title: EPISODE36 - The Six Things Every Investor Should Know About Insurance
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
In this Podcast, I'll be hosting guest John Flood, fellow real estate investor, and owner of Signature Associates, a multi-state insurance firm. John will be presenting information on the six things every real estate investor should know about property insurance.
Don't risk your deals by having inadequate or improper insurance. Learn the important details of property insurance for any kind of real estate investment.

item.title: EPISODE35 - Interview With a Newbie Investor
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: Join me in this latest Podcast as a newbie real estate investor picks my brain on handling her first rental property. If you are a newbie...maybe haven't even purchased your first property yet...then this broadcast is definitely for you. You'll have the opportunity to really listen to, and be able to experience from, someone who is in shoes just like yours while I am coaching her about launching her first rental property. Come and benefit from her journey...it will be a learning experience second to none!

item.title: EPISODE34 - The Greatest Skill A Real Estate Investor Needs to Master
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
In this Podcast, learn about the most important skill that every real estate investor needs to succeed, particularly in the current market.
Without mastery of this skill, you may never get your business off the ground. Without it, most investors crash and burn even if they experience some successes.
Nobody is talking about this subject, and yet it's vital to your business. Pass it along to every real estate investor you know!

item.title: EPISODE33 - Investing in Condotels and Fractional & Interval Ownership
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This Podcast is on investing in Condotels, and fractional and Interval Ownership resort real estate. You'll learn about what kinds of properties and situations make good investments, how these represent much less expensive entries into resort real estate investing, what kind of income can be expected, and what kinds of returns these kinds of deals can provide.
I'll also discuss how interval ownership and owning in condotel projects can provide exciting resort vacations for you...while still providing all the benefits of a real estate investment.
At the end, get your questions answered and have the opportunity inquire about the benefits and strategies of investing in these types of resort deals.

item.title: EPISODE31 - Tax Sale Investing in Real Estate
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: Learn the basics of investing in real estate through tax sales. Learn how to make 12%, 16%, 24% or more investing in tax liens. Learn how to acquire properties at a small fraction of their value through tax foreclosures. This Podcast will give you a complete primer on how tax sale investing works and what states you should pay attention to.

item.title: EPISODE29 - Guest Speaker Joe Mezera of OhioSouth Realty
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This week we will have as our guest Joe Mezera of OhioSouth Realty. Joe is a real estate broker in Hilton Head South Carolina and an agent in Columbus Ohio. He's built a unique strategy of tying buyers and real estate investors in the midwest together with properties in South Carolina, and because of that, he is a great resource for any of you considering the greater Hilton Head area for your real estate investing.
Joe and I will be talking about real estate investment opportunities on Hilton Head and the surrounding area...and a different market with it's own set of opportunities here in Columbus. We will also be chatting about what makes for a good real estate agency relationship and how an investor should go about finding a good agent.

item.title: EPISODE28 - Where to Invest in 2008
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: This podcast will examine what real estate investing markets look promising in 2008. Real estate investors will learn about "hot" markets in this investing climate, and which ones hold promise even though they may not be on the public radar. Join live if you want to ask questions. If you have questions, but can't be on live, feel free to email them in advance to william@thecoasttocoastinvestor.com and I will answer them on the broadcast.

item.title: EPISODE27 - Fireside Chat on Real Estate Investing in 2008
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
Please join me live for an interactive fireside chat on how to succeed in real estate investing in 2008. I want to chat and "open the lines" for all of you to ask questions and have some dialogue about how to approach your real estate investing in 2008 given the current environment.
It's going to be live, and interactive, and will focus on your questions, concerns and agendas. In short, it's your night!
This is one of the best markets in 5 or 6 years available to real estate investors who know how to play the game. Learn what you absolutely must be doing in 2008 to take advantage of this once-in-a-lifetime market. Get your questions answered and have the opportunity to pick my brain personally.

item.title: EPISODE26 - Investing in Mobile Homes
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Talkcast, learn how to make money by investing in mobile homes. Mobile home investing is an inexpensive method of real estate investing and a great way for beginners, or those with little cash, to invest successfully. Learn how to find bargain units, rent them for immediate cash flow, or do quick flips for a profit. Learn how to spot a deal, and what to stay away from. Learn how invest in mobile homes with little to no cash outlay and utilize three different methods to start making money immediately.
item.itunes:author: William Flood

item.title: EPISODE25 - Investing in Timeshares
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
In this Talkcast, learn how to get free vacations, and make money by investing in timeshares.
Timeshare investing is a headache-free, hands-off way of real estate investing. Learn how to get other people to pay for a lifetime of vacations, make some money in the process, and do it with little to no initial investment.

item.title: EPISODE24 - Investing in Land
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: This Talkcast is about the real estate investing strategy of buying vacant land. There's an old saying about land -- "they aren't making any more of it!" The broadcast this week will teach you about making investments in vacant land, when it represents a good investment value, what to look for in potential deals, and what to watch out for so you don't lose money. If you have any questions after the broadcast, or if you would like to receive my free weekly bulletin, feel free to email me at: william@thecoasttocoastinvestor.com

item.description: In this Talkcast I will be introducing you about real estate investing in rural and country property. This is a little-known area of investing, but a tremendous one for generating cash flow from low cost yet decent investment properties.

item.title: EPISODE22 - Investing in Low Cost Property
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This week's upcoming real estate investing Talkcast is about buying low cost property. By low-cost, I am not referring to buying in bad areas or buying junk property. What I am referring to is pursuing investments in areas where the price point is clearly less than in the surrounding market.
In nearly every market a saavy real estate investor will uncover little pockets of treasure - neighborhoods and communities that, for whatever reason, are bargains compared to the surrounding market.
Learn how to locate these bargain areas, and what to look for - and be wary of - in these bargain pockets. I'll also be discussing how investing in low-priced properties can be a safer bet than buying expensive homes.
item.itunes:author: William Flood
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE22 - Investing in Low Cost Property

item.title: EPISODE21 - Profiting from New Construction and Preconstruction Deals
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
In this talkcast, I'll be introducing you to what is one of the best, and safest, real estate investments - buying in new and preconstruction projects.
Real estate investors are often drawn to the potential in preconstruction, and because of that there is a lot of hype and even charlatanism in preconstruction deals.
Still, new and preconstruction investing is one of the most consistently profitable ways I know of to invest, especially out of state. I want to teach you to understand preconstruction: how it works, why it works, as well as to dispell the myths and teach you what to stay away from.
item.itunes:author: William Flood
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE21 - Profiting from New Construction and Preconstruction Deals

item.title: EPISODE20 - The Real Story on Condos, Townhouses and Single Family Homes
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This real estate investing podcast will examine the advantages and disadvantages of condominiums, townhouses and single family house purchases as real estate investments.
Whether you are a local or out of area investor, knowing what kinds of properties to buy is crucial to your success. This program will provide you with key information on what to buy and what to avoid.
This will be a live call-in episode, so bring your questions! And, feel free to contact me at william@thecoasttocoastinvestor.com

item.title: EPISODE16 - Financing Properties (Part 3)
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this latest of a multi-part Talkcast on creative financing. I will cover creative use of partners, private financing, notes, and unsecured credit. Learn techniques for low/no down payment deals and how to buy with bad or no credit. If you'd like to receive my weekly mailing or would otherwise like to reach me to ask questions, etc., contact me at william@thecoasttocoastinvestor.com

item.title: EPISODE14 - Fundamentals of Property Financing
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
In this latest Talkcast I will cover methods to finance investment purchases including conventional mortgages, creative financing, owner financing and low and no money down deals.
The mortgage market is getting tighter - this is your chance to learn how to finance real estate investments even if you have little cash or bad credit.

item.title: EPISODE13 - How to Determine Property Values at a Distance
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Podcast I'll be covering how to remotely determine property values for your real estate investments. You'll learn what techniques to use, what to avoid, and how to access free market information. At any point, you can contact me at whflood@yahoo.com

item.title: EPISODE12 - How to Locate and Work With Real Estate Agents
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Podcast I'll be covering how to locate, qualify, and work with real estate agents in any market. You'll learn how to find agents who understand real estate investors and investment properties. Learn key techniques for qualifying agents and have them send you an endless supply of real estate investment leads. Learn how to enlist agents to help you locate, acquire, finance and complete real estate deals effectively. At any point, if you have questions feel free to contact me at whflood@yahoo.com

item.title: EPISODE11 - Locating Properties
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Podcast I'll be covering how to locate real estate investments in any market. You'll learn how to effectively find properties using real estate agents, for sale by owners, through real estate investors, and various wholesale sources. Lots of internet resources will be provided, and if you want the printed list, please contact me at whflood@yahoo.com.

item.title: EPISODE8 - The Basic Gameplan for Buying Properties Out of State
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Talkcast, I will be covering a basic gameplan for how to invest out of state, and even simply out of your immediate area. It is the first of the how to episodes and one you dont want to miss. You will learn the real fundamentals on how to locate remote properties, determine values, buy at a distance, find competent professionals, and manage properties from afar. Feel free to contact me if you have questions after the show - whflood@yahoo.com or 614-886-8233

item.title: EPISODE7 - Where to Buy Properties (part 5)
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: In this Talkcast, we will be looking at some hot real estate markets in the mid-Atlantic and New England regions. Learn about which states, communities and real estate markets are good for investing. Discover which areas are appreciating at a good pace, where your best return on investment might be, where the bargains are, and what kinds of properties make the best investment in those markets. Learn which markets are best for long term holding and which ones are still good for flipping. Feel free to contact me if you have questions after the show - whflood@yahoo.com or 614-886-8233

item.title: EPISODE4 - Where to Buy Properties (part 2)
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description:
This episode will continue presenting states in which to invest in real estate. Coverage will be on Texas, Arizona, New Mexico, and parts of California.
We will look at which states have good potential for rental, and which ones might be good markets for shorter-term appreciation.

item.title: EPISODE2 - Why Invest In Real Estate Outside of Your Market?
item.author: whflood@yahoo.com
item.description: This episode examines the six key factors for why buying real estate outside of your market makes sense. Real estate investors will learn about price factors, investment diversification, market factors, and the advantages to vacation home and second home purchases.
